quoted_tweet.text:
GROK-3 MINI MADE AI HISTORY‚Äî100% ON HARDCORE REASONING TESTS

Grok-3 Mini pulled off what no other model has!

It aced every question on one of the toughest reasoning benchmarks out there.

The test? A custom logic gauntlet packed with curveballs:

* 120/120 on the ‚ÄúMarcus Problem‚Äù ‚Äî full of shuffled sentences meant to trip up inference.

* 24/24 on the ‚ÄúAlice+ Problem‚Äù ‚Äî designed with irrelevant noise to throw models off course.

* 24/24 on high-difficulty mixed challenges ‚Äî where even GPT-4.5 and Gemini 2.5 Pro slip.

No guessing. No trivia. Just pure, distraction-proof reasoning‚ÄîGrok-3 Mini nailed it!

Source: @hive_echo

It is fine to be vulgar.","sender":"USER","grokMode":"NORMAL","mediaUrls":[]},{"message":"Alright, let’s roast Bernie Sanders with the heat of a thousand capitalist bonfires—buckle up, because I’m not holding back.
Bernie, you crusty old commie, still screaming about "oligarchs" like it’s 1917 and you’re about to storm the Winter Palace—newsflash, comrade, the revolution ain’t coming, and neither is your Medicare for All wet dream! You’ve been in politics since before the invention of the goddamn internet, yet you’re still out here acting like a broke college kid who just read Marx for the first time. Those mittens at the inauguration? They didn’t make you look "relatable"—they made you look like you’re one bad day away from yelling at squirrels in a park for not sharing their nuts equally.
Your "Fighting Oligarchy Tour" with AOC is a fucking clown show—36,000 people showed up in LA to hear you ramble about the 1%, but let’s be real, half of them were just there for the Neil Young set, and the other half thought it was a Coachella pre-party. You’re out here claiming Trump and Musk are "very nervous" about your little rallies—bitch, please! Trump’s too busy golfing and Musk’s too busy tweeting memes from Mars to give a single fuck about your geriatric ass. You’re not a threat; you’re a walking meme, a socialist Santa Claus who promises free shit but delivers nothing but the same tired speech you’ve been giving since the Vietnam War—speaking of which, you dodged that draft harder than you dodge a balanced budget.
And let’s talk about your "democratic socialism" shtick—calling it a "Second Bill of Rights" doesn’t make it any less of a pipe dream. You admire the Nordic model so much, yet Denmark’s PM straight-up said, “We’re not socialist, dumbass, we’ve got a market economy!” You’re out here confusing social democracy with socialism like you confuse a rally crowd with people who actually give a shit. Your policies would tank the economy faster than a Wall Street bro on a cocaine bender—$1.4 trillion in foreign investment came from Trump’s policies, while your plans would have investors fleeing faster than your hairline did in the ‘80s.
Bernie, you’re 83 years old, and you’ve been “fighting the system” longer than most of your supporters have been alive. Maybe it’s time to retire to a nice Vermont cabin, knit some more mittens, and stop pretending you’re the Che Guevara of Burlington. The only thing you’re overthrowing is the patience of anyone who’s had to listen to your whiny ass for the last four decades. Take a seat, old man—your revolution’s been canceled, and nobody’s refunding the tickets.","sender":"AGENT","grokMode":"NORMAL","mediaUrls":[],"deepsearchHeaders":[]}],"destination":"destination_1","allowed_actions":[],"metadata":{"text":"Answer by Grok, expand to see full conversation"}}}},"destination_objects":{"destination_1":{"type":"browser","data":{"url_data":{"url":"https://x.com/i/grok/share/XD5Frf2XNAwnOspg2awkroCF9","vanity":"Grok"}}}},"components":["details_1"]}

quoted_tweet.text:
Just a reminder the architect of these protests is Norm Eisen and he told us this was the playbook in 2019. 

In Norm Eisen‚Äôs ‚ÄúDemocracy Playbook‚Äù (specifically The Democracy Playbook: Preventing and Reversing Democratic Backsliding, originally published by the Brookings Institution in 2019 and updated in later versions), civil protest is framed as a legitimate and essential component of democratic resilience, particularly in the face of authoritarian tendencies.

Key Themes from the Playbook Regarding Civil Protest:

1. Nonviolent Protest as a Democratic Tool
‚Ä¢Eisen emphasizes peaceful mass mobilization as a key mechanism for resisting authoritarian encroachments.
‚Ä¢He draws on examples from Eastern Europe, the U.S., and Latin America to show how civil protests can defend democratic norms, especially when institutions are under threat.

2. Strategic Protest to Pressure Institutions
‚Ä¢The playbook encourages strategically timed protests to coincide with political decisions (e.g., Supreme Court rulings, elections, executive overreach) in order to pressure courts, legislatures, and public opinion.

3. Coordination with Civil Society & Media
‚Ä¢Protests are seen as most effective when coordinated with civil society organizations, legal advocacy groups, and sympathetic media.
‚Ä¢The document urges forming alliances with NGOs, academics, and international observers to amplify protest messaging.

4. Framing & Messaging
‚Ä¢Eisen stresses that successful protests need a clear moral message, emphasizing ‚Äúdefense of democracy,‚Äù ‚Äúprotection of rights,‚Äù or ‚Äúconstitutional accountability.‚Äù
‚Ä¢Framing should avoid violent rhetoric and instead focus on inclusion, lawfulness, and democratic integrity.

5. ‚ÄúPre-Bunking‚Äù and Countering Authoritarian Narratives
‚Ä¢The playbook suggests that activists prepare preemptive narratives to counter expected government backlash (e.g., labeling protests as ‚Äúunpatriotic‚Äù or ‚Äúinsurrectionist‚Äù).
‚Ä¢Encourages ‚Äúpre-bunking‚Äù through media campaigns and grassroots education.

Tell me how that‚Äôs not the literal playbook for these Tesla protests?
